New Records: Rohit Sharma broke the record for the most sixes in ODI cricket with 302 sixes.
India extended their unbeaten World Cup record against Pakistan to 8-0.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2/19 in seven overs, setting up India's victory.
Key Match Events: India won the match by 7 wickets in 19.3 overs.
Pakistan collapsed to 36 runs, their worst collapse in ODI history.
Rohit Sharma scored a quickfire fifty with six fours and six sixes.
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a significant morale booster for India ahead of the World Cup.
Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
Only Gayle and Afridi have hit more sixes in World Cup history than Rohit Sharma.
India have now failed to win just four of their last 29 World Cup games.
Others: Sachin Tendulkar brought out the World Cup trophy before the match.
Babar Azam scored his first ODI fifty against India in this match.
